channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Malaysia: Philippines claim over Sabah has no basis
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Malaysian government has maintained that the Philippine claim over Sabah has no basis in international law.

item.title: ‘Julian’ to intensify into a typhoon
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: Tropical Storm Julian is expected to further intensify into a typhoon, but is unlikely to directly affect the weather in the country, according to the Philippine Atmospheric Geophysical Astronomical Services Administration.

item.title: House OKs bills creating medical reserve corps
item.author: Edu Punay
item.description: President Duterte vowed to get the country back on its feet as he appealed to Congress to approve next year’s proposed P4.506-trillion budget, which is higher by 9.9 percent than the 2020 national budget and is equivalent to 21.8- percent of our Gross Domestic Product.

item.title: Bong Go: Duterte eyeing silent worker as new PhilHealth chief
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: President Duterte may choose a “silent worker” to replace resigned Philippine Health Insurance Corp. president and CEO Ricardo Morales amid allegations of corruption in the agency, Sen. Bong Go announced yesterday.

item.title: Rebuilding set to start for Marawi mosques
item.author: Rhodina Villanueva
item.description: Reconstruction of three Marawi City mosques destroyed during the 2017 siege will start soon, the Task Force Bangon Marawi (TFBM) said.

item.title: Duterte: 2021 budget crucial to recovery
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: President Duterte vowed to get the country back on its feet as he appealed to Congress to approve next year’s proposed P4.506-trillion budget, which is higher by 9.9 percent than the 2020 national budget and is equivalent to 21.8 percent of the country’s Gross Domestic Product.

item.title: Government urged to elevate arbitration ruling to UN General Assembly
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Former top officials have called on the Philippine government to elevate the arbitration ruling on the South China Sea dispute to the United Nations General Assembly next month.

item.title: Zamboanga on alert for 3 Sayyaf bombers
item.author: Roel Pareño
item.description: Two Indonesian members of the terror group Abu Sayyaf – including a woman – and a Filipino militant may have slipped into the Zamboanga peninsula to launch terror attacks, officials said yesterday.

item.title: ‘New lockdowns to irreversibly injure economy’
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Health Secretary Francisco Duque III yesterday ruled out placing the National Capital Region again under stricter lockdown despite the continuing rise in cases of COVID-19, saying doing so would irreparably damage the economy.

item.title: Duterte bemoans Japan PM Abe's resignation over health problems
item.author: Ratziel San Juan
item.description: "It is with much regret that I learned of Prime Minister Abe Shinzo's resignation."
